summary: This is a jury questionnaire for the criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell in the Southern District of New York. It outlines the charges against Maxwell, provides instructions to potential jurors, and asks a series of questions to assess their impartiality, knowledge of the case, and ability to serve. The trial is scheduled to begin on November 29, 2021, and is expected to last approximately six weeks.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant charged with conspiring with and aiding Jeffrey Epstein to entice and transport minors for criminal sexual activity and sex trafficking from at least 1994 to 2004.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the individual with whom Maxwell conspired and aided in the crimes of enticing minors to travel for sexual activity and sex trafficking.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York at the time of the questionnaire; potential jurors are asked if they have any opinion of him that might affect impartiality.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The former Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York; potential jurors are asked if they have any opinion of her that might affect impartiality.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case; potential jurors are asked if they personally know her or her staff.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: An attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP representing the defendant; potential jurors are asked if they personally know him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Pagliuca
persons.context: An attorney from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. representing the defendant; potential jurors are asked if they personally know him.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: An attorney from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. representing the defendant; potential jurors are asked if they personally know her.

persons.name: Bobbi Stemheim
persons.context: An attorney from the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim representing the defendant; potential jurors are asked if they personally know her.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged with conspiring with and aiding Epstein to commit crimes related to enticing minors to travel for sexual activity and sex trafficking.
Christian Everdell is listed as one of the defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell.
Jeffrey Pagliuca is listed as one of the defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell.
Laura Menninger is listed as one of the defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell.
Bobbi Stemheim is listed as one of the defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell.
Both are/were U.S. Attorneys for the Southern District of New York, with Strauss being the former Acting U.S. Attorney.

events.title: Trial of Ghislaine Maxwell Commences
events.description: The criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin on this date in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Jury Selection for Maxwell Trial
events.description: Potential jurors are to be called back for further questioning and jury selection during this period.

events.title: Alleged Criminal Conspiracy Period
events.description: The period during which Ghislaine Maxwell is alleged to have conspired with Jeffrey Epstein to commit crimes involving minors.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
Constance Baker Motley Jury Assembly Room
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with six counts related to conspiring with and aiding Jeffrey Epstein to entice minors to travel for sexual activity, transport minors for sexual activity, and engage in sex trafficking of a minor from at least 1994 to 2004.
Maxwell has pleaded not guilty to all charges and is presumed innocent; the government must prove guilt beyond a reasonable doubt.
The trial is scheduled to begin on November 29, 2021, and is expected to last approximately six weeks, with jury selection occurring from November 16-19, 2021.
The presiding judge is Alison J. Nathan, and the defense attorneys include Christian Everdell, Jeffrey Pagliuca, Laura Menninger, and Bobbi Stemheim.
The questionnaire instructs potential jurors to avoid all media coverage and discussions about the case and not to conduct any independent research.
